comment.text: GTP-binding protein that possesses intrinsic GTPase activity. Contributes to the polarizing activity of KRIT1 and CDH5 in the establishment and maintenance of correct endothelial cell polarity and vascular lumen. Required for the localization of phosphorylated PRKCZ, PARD3 and TIAM1 to the cell junction. Plays a role in the establishment of basal endothelial barrier function.
Activated by binding to the GTPase-activating protein RAP1GAP. Activated by guanine nucleotide-exchange factor (GEF) EPAC2 in a cAMP-dependent manner.
Heterodimer with RAP1GAP. Interacts with EPAC2, SGSM1, SGSM2 and SGSM3. Interacts with KRIT1.
May shuttle between plasma membrane and cytosol. Presence of KRIT1 and CDH5 is required for its localization to the cell junction.
Belongs to the small GTPase superfamily. Ras family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: GRB2:SOS provides linkage to MAPK signaling for Integrins

Expressed in monocyte and 116 other tissues
P:negative regulation of calcium ion-dependent exocytosis
P:negative regulation of synaptic vesicle exocytosis
P:positive regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade
P:regulation of establishment of cell polarity

feature.description: Strong reduction in nucleotide exchange with EPAC2.
Abolishes complex formation with RAP1GAP. Loss GTPase activity.
